intro: Dalechampia alata, commonly known as the winged hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers and distinctive, wing-like structures on its stems. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and can vary in size depending on the environment. Dalechampia alata is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and tropical aesthetic.
